Asia Pacific stocks were mostly down on Friday morning  as the latest regulatory tightening in China and the spread of COVID-19's Delta variant globally sour investor sentiment.China‚Äôs Shanghai Composite inched down 0.07% by 10:02 PM ET (2:02 AM GMT) and the Shenzhen Component was down 0.23%. China expanded its regulation tightening exercise to the real estate sectors  with private equity funds suspended from raising money to invest in residential property development.The latest COVID-19 outbreak in the country also forced the partial shutdown of Ningbo-Zhoushan port  with concerns growing about a repeat of 2020‚Äôs shipping challenges.
